page.title: 07ECOLOGY AND NATURAL HISTORY
page.content: The prevailing wind is a strong S.W.,sweeping across Dartmoor,making shelter a priority.Fog can descend very suddenly on the hills.Soil is thin and acid,drying out easily in drought. The most important footpath in the area,the Mariners' Way,passes from Lettaford through Jurston to Shapley. An old tinners' track from Great Weeke passes over Week Down, joining the North Bovey road near Middlecott.A path leads from New Street to Nattadon, and a bridle path passes through Horselake. {Birds:}pairs of buzzards are a common sight.Woodpeckers,jays,nuthatches and tree-creepers inhabit the woods.Barn owls are breeding at Horselake.There are ravens on Meldon.Herons,Canada geeseand mallard frequent ponds at Thorn.Fieldfares and redwings are winter visitors.
